title: Thin film - normal and angled waves - air-oil-H2O

content.question: The figure shows two electromagnetic waves that are incident upon a thin, uniform layer of oil floating on top of water. Wave <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has a wavelength <math alttext="lambda sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and is normally incident on the oil surface, while Wave <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has an unspecified wavelength and an angle of incidence <math alttext="theta is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Each wave has a reflection at the air-oil interface as well as at the oil-water interface, and the oil film has the minimum thickness at which, for Wave <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, maximum constructive interference occurs between these two reflections. Which of the following claims about Wave <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is correct?

choices.label: The two reflections of Wave <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> cannot interfere constructively for any wavelength value.

If the two reflections of Wave <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> interfere constructively, its wavelength could be either longer than or shorter than <math alttext="lambda sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.

If Wave <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has a wavelength of <math alttext="lambda sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, the two reflections of Wave <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> must interfere constructively.

The phase change due to transmission at the air-oil interface could be different for Wave <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> than for Wave <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

content.answer: If the two reflections of Wave <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> interfere constructively, its wavelength could be either longer than or shorter than <math alttext="lambda sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.
